result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor K. Altreuter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF287 & 14CF291 called together at 10:10 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Taylor K. Altreuter in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court notes that Case 14CF291 was dismissed and read in at plea hearing

14CF487:Sentencing arguments by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 30 months, with conditions:
--serve 30 days jail without Huber privileges for any purpose to commence forthwith.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Undergo testing for any illegal drug use & alcohol 
--To pay costs of $
268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No direct or indirect contact with Scott Hayes
--No contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Days credit for time already served: 4 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court presents basis and grants expungement if Defendant successfully completes probation by definition of statute
Recess: 10:41 am
Sentencing hearing on January 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Cases 14CF287 & 14CF291 called together at 9:17 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Taylor K. Altreuter in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF287: On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the on or near enhancer on Count #1

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#2 & Case 14CF291

Atty De La Rosa requests matter be set out approx. 60 days for sentencing, presents basis
ADA Teuber: No objection
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Ms. Altreuter
Recess: 9:22 am   

NEXT: 14CF287 (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing no sooner than 60 days - Send notices (2) Have case 14CF291 available at sentencing
Status conference on October 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF287 & #14CF291 called at 11:18am. 
Defendant Taylor K. Altreuter in court with Attorney Jeffrey J. De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Altreuter waives her right to Preliminary Hearings in both cases; the Court accepts these waivers and binds her over for Trials.

Arraignment held in each case :
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Ms. Altreuter verifies that the Jackson Street address remains current. 
recess 11:23am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/24/14 at 10:20am  (2) schedule both cases for Status Conference approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial
Status conference on September 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 1:58 pm
Defendant Taylor K. Altreuter in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint cousel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court finds the criminal complaint states probable cause.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 signature bond, with conditions:
-Defendant must appear at the 9/2/14 Status Conference.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Attorney Zarwell requests that this case be set for a status on 9/2/14 the Preliminary Hearing date for her other case.
Court grants the request.

Recess: 2:04 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Status: 9/2/14 at 11:00 am
